revised_title: Urethral Stone Removal and the Role of Inflammation
tldr: This article describes a case study of a patient who passed a large stone through the perineum from the urethra. The author discusses the role of inflammation in the formation and removal of urethral stones, as well as the process of stone formation in the urethra. The patient experienced pain and discomfort before the stone was passed, and the author provides a detailed account of the patient's condition and the surgical intervention used to remove the stone.
